column6: Job/Team Function

column5: Chairman of the JIC and Professional Head of Intelligence Analysis
column6: To chair the Joint Intelligence Committee and to oversee the work of the Assessments Staff so as to ensure effective support for the Prime Minister and the National Security Council through provision of timely, accurate and objective all-source intelligence assessments. To oversee the work of the intelligence analytical community across government, so as to ensure the development of necessary capabilities and skills.

column5: Chief Operating Officer, Efficiency and Reform
column6: The Chief Operating Officer, UK Government's role is to support the Minister for the Cabinet Office and the Chief Secretary to the Treasury to implement the Government's Efficiency and Reform agenda by driving major changes in the way the business of government operates.

column5: Permanent Secretary, Prime Minister's Adviser, Head of the European & Global Issues Secretariat
column6: EGIS is responsible for coordinating the work of Government in reaching collective agreement on International Economic (including G20/G8, international trade and development issues) and European policy and to provide advice on these matters to the Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Minister, and the Cabinet Office Minister for Government Policy

column5: Permanent Secretary, Prime Minister's National Security Adviser
column6: Adviser to the Prime Minister

column5: Permanent Secretary of the Cabinet Office and First Parliamentary Counsel
column6: Richard has a dual role. Richard Heaton is Permanent Secretary for the Cabinet Office with responsibility for the leadership and governance of the Cabinet Office, as well as being Accounting Officer. He is also First Parliamentary Counsel, overseeing the Government in Parliament Group, which includes Parliamentary Counsel and the Business Managers in each House. The Group works with teams across government to prepare and deliver the government’s legislative programme.

column5: Director General, Economic and Domestic Affairs Secretariat
column6: Director General of the Secretariat supporting effective Cabinet Government and ensuring the Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Minister, Minister for Government Policy and the Cabinet Secretary have access to high quality advice and briefing; supporting the development, co-ordination and implementation of economic and domestic policy objectives.  Oversight of the Implementation Group which drives and co-ordinates the domestic policy business of Government.

column5: Deputy National Security Adviser, Intelligence Security and Resilience
column6: Within the National Security Secretariat, the Deputy National Security Adviser leads on supporting the Prime Minister on: Counter Terrorism; Intelligence Policy; The governance and resourcing of the secret intelligence agencies; Cyber Security; Resilience and Crisis Management.

column5: Director General, Prime Minister's Appointments Secretary
column6: Prime Minister's Appointments Secretary

Responsible for reforming Whitehall governance, in support to Lord Browne and the Minister for the Cabinet Office, to: ensure a substantial increase in the concentration of business expertise in Government through the appointment of Non-executive Directors in every Whitehall Department; improve the effectiveness of Boards in providing the strategic and operational leadership of each Department through working with the Non-executives and with the Permanent Secretaries on their new senior governance arrangements; and drive up performance in the delivery of Departmental business plans and support implementation of HMGs policy reform agenda. Responsible for managing business relationships on behalf of No.10 and Cabinet Office, and for delivering priority Prime Minister and Deputy Prime Minister Every Business Commits policy initiatives, in partnership with business.

Senior Assistant Parliamentary Counsel work in the drafting teams which  draft Bills (and amendments of Bills) for Government in response to instructions, and which provide procedural and other handling advice to legislating departments in connection with those Bills. They vet draft statutory instruments that amend primary legislation, and draft statutory instruments in cases where the specialist expertise  of Parliamentary Counsel is required. They provide assistance to more senior counsel.

column5: Efficiency Cluster Lead Chief Procurement Officer
column6:
Government’s Chief Procurement Officer (CPO) leads the Efficiency Cluster in delivering efficiency savings and is responsible for:
-The Government Procurement Service: buying £11bn of goods and services for the public sector each year and to aggregate, and where appropriate centralise, spend across all government departments.
-Procurement Policy: all cross cutting policy affecting the £45bn spent each year by Whitehall, including EU engagement and ensuring SMEs have fair access to Government contracts.
-Commercial Relationships:  Building strategic relationships with key suppliers to deliver cost reductions, performance improvements and ideas for reforming public service delivery. 
-Reviewing how Government does business,  i.e. contract, for  large and  complex services, and support renegotiation of such contracts with HMG.

column5: Head of HR Strategy Planning and Business Partnering
column6: Human Resource Management

Responsible for delivering an HR service to the Civil Service’s 400,000+ employees and management. To ensure that the HR service is cost-effective and supports the customer-focused delivery of the Civil Service’s activities, and responsible for HR professional development and for introducing Next Generation HR. The introduction of Next Generation HR allows the HR profession to work together across government, ensuring the delivery of HR services more efficiently and effectively. Also responsible for the HR actions in the Civil Service Reform Plan including implementation of the Capabilities Plan; secondments and interchange; common standards of promotion, improving the modern workplace and employment offer; all contributing to delivering an exceptional civil service that is more skilled, less bureaucratic and more unified.

To deliver the Next Generation HR phase 2 programme to design and deliver the operating model for the HR function across government for April 2014 and beyond, ensuring the efficient and effective delivery of HR services to the Civil Service

Implementation of the Capabilities Plan, which will enable us to become a more unified and skills Civil Service.  There are 4 priority areas for raising capability: leading and managing change; commercial skills and behaviours; programme and project management; and digital skills.  The Capabilities Plan also looks at the role of professions across government.
Build a strong and effective civil service HR function, through developing HR capability, talent, and the HR graduate Fast Stream.
Delivery of strengthening functional leadership across government
Programme management, policy development for the functional leadership programme
Major Projects Cluster Lead
